page.title: 09EDUCATION_THE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school buildings are vested in the church but are controlled by the county. Present figures are 3 staff, plus 1 part_time for 2 days and a remedial for 1/2 a day. The school has a hall, playground and swimming pool and the use of the town's playing field. The school has many clubs eg. netball, football and recorders. Parents and sixth form girls from the Grammar School help in the classes. In the last 5 years the number of pupils has dropped from 120. There has also been a change in the Head Teacher. This summer they are having new terrapins with the old buildings being demolished: Also there is the possibility of extending or re_siting the school to provide for any extra pupils resulting from the new developments planned.
